channel.title: Hello! I'm Justin Higgins and I know nothing about sales and marketing so I built 24hourhomepage.com
channel.description:
# Hello Bootstrapped !
I'm Justin Higgins and I know nothing about sales and marketing.
Let me explain.
I've been a professional software engineer for over 10 years now and have wanted to build something of my own. I've tried a few side projects but have had a pretty big flaw in my thinking execution:
I never wanted to *sell or market* my work.
That's no good.
So I built **24hourhomepage (dot) com** in order to get better at sales and marketing.
The service is simple: There are 86,400 seconds in a day and each is sold as an advertisement. Once each second is sold, the project is over and the site lives on indefinitely as an internet artifact.
## Why would I advertise here?
There are endless reasons why people are advertising on **24hourhomepage (dot) com**, but here are a few:
### 1. Cost 💰
Traditional digital advertisements are expensive and often based on pay-per-click (PPC) model. Here, you buy your ad once and keep it forever.
### 2. Captive and engaged audience 👀
24hourhomepage (dot) com visitors ***want*** to click an ad. There is no better engagement out there. For viewers who set us as their homepage, they’re not only **an engaged audience** they’re **a captive audience.**
### 3. Have fun with your brand 🏄‍♂
You can “hide” discounts or jokes on the site as easter eggs for your customers. It's cost effective and lets your customers know you aren't afraid to have fun.
### 4. Vanity 💎
You can tell everyone you "own" a piece of the day. Or buy your sweetie her birthsecond. Or invest in your idea by claiming the link won't be dead far in the future.
### 5. Money back guarantee 💯
All sales are made with a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you want a refund, you get a refund.
# I'd love to hear your feedback 👂 Email: justin (at) 24hourhomepage (dot) com

item.description:
Thanks for your question, yinhowlew! Right now i’m doing direct sales and marketing by reaching out to content creators i think could make engaging pieces (to “hide” for discoverability) and to get the word out a bit more. I’ve considered an embedded advertising strategy but its not in my immediate plans. I’ll consider it again

I’m documenting my efforts at @higgins (medium) and @justinprojects (twitter) if you want to see how I’m growing it.

item.title: Hello! I'm Justin Higgins and I know nothing about sales and marketing so I built 24hourhomepage.com
item.dc:creator: yinhowlew
item.description:
Congrats on launching. Really fun product! reminds me of the million dollar homepage back in the days but with a more fun and engaging twist.

As a business, my natural first question is: what are your plans to get visitors to your site? It seems like something people might check out 1 time, but has little incentive to return.

Or maybe you are planning other distribution strategy - e.g. having the square embed to other websites / apps?
